Final Assessment: Take-Home Final
1L elective and upper level
Crosslisted with Candler and undergrad Dept of Religion
This course is eligible to be counted towards the requirements for the J.D. concentration in Law and Religion.
course_description: Religious liberty is one of the hallmarks of modern constitutional democracies, though it has come under considerable attack in recent years. This course analyzes the historical formation and current interpretation of the religious liberty guarantees of the First Amendment to the United States Constitution.
sections: Class Nbr: 2741, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 12-1:30p, Instructor: J. Witte Jr., Status: Open
